9F402ED079704D2B92D6F9DFC7F30625.description:
Plan and carry out an investigation of a local ecosystem to assess human impacts. Based on your
findings, design and evaluate a solution to minimize impacts.

8C5F59B42ABB448487DB4C145164D890.description:
Research and communicate information on an environmental science career. Analyze the role of
society, engineering, technology, and science in that career.

469D04DDE2374EBDA85633129CD5AF98.description:
Engage in argument from evidence on the role engineering and technology play in a sustainable
human society.

30BA3CC129F74C2EA24A503E287F3183.description:
Links Among Engineering, Technology, Science, and
Society

73057950B1724A329BBD9B64ADA1BF02.description:
Use mathematics to calculate ecological footprints. Develop a personal plan for reducing your
impact on the environment.

9A7CAA68F8574E6F89EBE9A53F35A0D1.description:
Using mathematics and computational thinking, analyze data linking human activity to climate
change. Design solutions to address human impacts on climate change.

38624258CEED4C25B207806A05D88B80.description:
Obtain, evaluate, and communicate scientific information tracing the breakdown of ozone
caused by chlorofluorocarbons and the effectiveness of efforts to address this environmental
problem.

D25E2C989A8C4298AF368D56B76C3992.description:
Evaluate current methods of waste management and reduction and design possible
improvements.

DA33D53212D8446290564B3AEB8ABE56.description:
Obtain and communicate information on environmental laws pertaining to the regulation of
pollution and on regulatory agencies. Provide a specific example of how a given
business/industry would comply with such regulations.

8244E22314F044DEB8354369051EF215.description:
Analyze and interpret data on the effects of land, water, and air pollution on the environment
and on human health. Propose solutions for minimizing pollution from specific sources.

6E4CFC1F56D743B1AAAD0D10E28DDD4D.description:
Ask questions about technology needed to develop alternative energy sources and obtain
information from various sources to answer those questions.

59EEB2DB9DC74E1482E825DE040C7424.description:
Define problems and suggest solutions associated with using, conserving, and recycling energy
and mineral resources taking into account economic, social, and environmental costs and
benefits.

EFB4FF2F132447F5AFFB6E5A81E171BB.description:
Using scientific data, analyze effectiveness of conservation versus preservation efforts. Obtain
and communicate information on organizations involved in protecting natural resources.

20A71953259F4C80819D9A20FF5A23A8.description:
Evaluate ecosystem services provided by forests ecosystems. Construct an explanation for
human impact on these services.

CB8B0A33C6E4459480292DBB2BE9C4EB.description:
Research information on the environmental impacts of genetically modified organisms and
engage in debate regarding pros and cons of this agricultural technology.

DFFB51084C674051BBC6A4702BDB2E29.description:
Construct an argument including claim, evidence, and scientific reasoning regarding the impact
of the Green Revolution on agricultural practices, food availability, and the environment.

0A4C0E7C4DC44C42ABB8B7889847E0E0.description:
Use a model to make predictions regarding the impact of topsoil loss due to erosion resulting
from human activity. Design, evaluate, and revise a solution to preserve topsoil.

C43A4B6A8CBA44C6968C4355527AD779.description:
Plan and carry out an investigation examining best management practices in water usage,
agriculture, forestry, urban/suburban development, mining, or fishing and communicate
findings.

82683468D29D4C11915FB2648EE4AE6E.description:
Gather, organize, analyze, and present data on current land use trends by humans. Based on
analysis, predict future trends.

925B0CECDCF645BBA57C8F1EAA11CC15.description:
Obtain and evaluate information regarding demographics for a variety of countries. Construct an
explanation for varying fertility rates and life expectancies between countries and throughout
human history. Taking into account demographic transition, predict what trends are likely to
occur in various countries over time.

758BF190815F45A8850B8F7F43B5CDBA.description:
Interpret graphical data representing global human population growth over time. Look for
patterns within this data and construct possible explanations for the patterns. Revise the
explanations as needed based on research.

C62E52DD87104B5389107E58A9D3D6D0.description:
Research Earth’s natural resources (renewable and nonrenewable resources). Construct an
argument from evidence supporting the claim that a particular type of resource is important for
humans.

69D0CD80B14B4BE1BDC85DE2FA0C0651.description: Develop a model to explain soil formation and the flow of matter in the rock cycle.

251F7A2C722A444D9A2AA62C2C982010.description:
Plan and carry out an investigation examining the chemical and physical properties of water and
the impact of water on Earth’s topography. Analyze data and share findings.

336381D99DD94595820E8B60BE327136.description:
Differentiate weather and climate and analyze and interpret data examining naturally occurring
patterns pertaining to each.

85E622AB26AE42C8A39CD9FD91015D55.description:
Analyze the composition of the Earth’s atmosphere. Obtain information and use graphs to
observe patterns regarding stability and change within the Earth’s atmospheric composition
(O2, N2, CO2, etc.) over geologic time.

596F64C3B5384BC6B9033386D3E6D2C3.description:
Considering Earth’s position within our solar system, use a model to demonstrate the causes of
day length, seasons, and climate.

FC54D341932948A3845F33470975EAC2.description:
Research the development of the theory of plate tectonics. Use the theory to construct an
explanation for how changes in Earth’s crust cause mountain formation, volcanoes,
earthquakes, and tsunamis. Provide evidence to support the explanation using information
pertaining to plate boundary types (divergent, convergent, transform).

0812C0F887E74FFE8F3A37168B45141D.description:
Engage in argument from scientific evidence critiquing effectiveness of the Endangered Species
Act. Give specific examples to support your argument.

D1C59C874A1845D285673CA22464BB33.description:
Evaluate the impact of habitat fragmentation and destruction, invasive species, overharvesting,
pollution, and climate change on biodiversity (genetic, species, and ecosystem).

2C3BA433BB29463491847B0AAC1EED5D.description:
Justify claims with scientific evidence that changes in environmental conditions lead to
speciation and extinction.

A4FF697585D441DCBD0F865D7CBAE947.description:
Construct an explanation based on scientific evidence for mechanisms of natural selection that
result in behavioral, anatomical, and physiological adaptations in populations.

7B204170DCAC497C80913AB177DC1E16.description:
Examine stability and change within an ecosystem by using a model of succession (primary or
secondary) to predict impacts of disruption on an ecosystem.

8C5452882F824F6B86E1E8316D080CAC.description:
Evaluate the interdependence among major biogeochemical cycles (water, carbon, nitrogen,
phosphorus) in an ecosystem and recognize the importance each cycle has in maintaining
ecosystem stability.

8DE053D2728C44F58B21B16E18E6A7FD.description:
Use a mathematical model to explain energy flow through an ecosystem. Using the first and
second laws of thermodynamics, construct an explanation for: A) necessity for constant energy
input; B) limitations on energy transfer from one trophic level to the next; and, C) limitations on
number of trophic levels that can be supported.

0E0CF614EC9F40B1945746D94507611B.description:
Compare and contrast production (photosynthesis, chemosynthesis) and respiratory (aerobic
respiration, anaerobic respiration, consumption, decomposition) processes responsible for the
cycling of matter and flow of energy through an ecosystem. Using evidence, construct an
argument regarding the importance of homeostasis in maintaining these processes in
ecosystems.

95D7DAB2449046EF9BE9CAD30B552689.description:
Using mathematical models, support arguments regarding the effects of biotic and abiotic
factors on carrying capacity for populations within an ecosystem.

FDC24B9C0B284039B3B5BBD811E9FDF6.description:
Develop an explanation of behavioral and physical adaptations organisms have for life in aquatic
habitats with varying chemical and physical features.

78B4352B5C784035BD1441452D92EC3F.description:
Using a variety of data sources, construct an explanation for the impact of climate, latitude,
altitude, geology, and hydrology patterns on plant and animal life in various terrestrial biomes.
